page.title: 07An old woman in Killamarsh
page.content: Our O.A.P. lived close to School so we walked there with our teacher. She lived in a very pretty and well looked after house on a Council Estate. She was a widow and her husband had died a year ago. She told us that she had lived in the house since it was built 42 years ago. She seemed very proud of her house. We asked her if she had many visitors but she said she didn't because people round there weren't in the habit of calling on each other although they would always help each other if there was trouble. She spent most of her spare time knitting for her Grandchildren who live in different parts of the country and she visits them quite often. She finds it difficult to manage on her Pension and especially thinks that having to pay a full Television Licence, when some O.A.P's don't, is very unfair.
